abstract: Richard D. Fain, chief of Royal Caribbean Cruises, says that today’s cruise lines are going after a younger and more active clientèle.
snippet: Richard D. Fain, chief of Royal Caribbean Cruises, says that today’s cruise lines are going after a younger and more active clientèle.
lead_paragraph: The American cruise line industry reaped $11 billion in sales last year, but is still frustrated by the fact that only 15 percent of Americans have ever gone on a cruise. It blames “myths” like the belief that cruises are boring, over-eating affairs for older people, says Richard D. Fain, chairman and chief executive of Royal Caribbean Cruises, the Miami-based cruise line.

headline.main: Casting Off the Myths of Cruises
headline.print_headline: Casting Off The Myths Of Cruises
